query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Già era in loco onde s’udia ’l rimbombo 2 de l’acqua che cadea ne l’altro giro, 3 simile a quel che l’arnie fanno rombo,
4 quando tre ombre insieme si partiro, 5 correndo, d’una torma che passava 6 sotto la pioggia de l’aspro martiro.
query.result:
**English:**
1 I was already in the place where one could hear the echo 2 of the water falling into the next circle, 3 similar to the buzzing sound that beehives make,
4 when three shades separated themselves from a group 5 that was running, passing by 6 under the rain of harsh suffering.
**Malay:**
1 Aku sudah berada di tempat di mana orang dapat mendengar gema 2 air yang jatuh ke dalam lingkaran berikutnya, 3 mirip dengan suara dengungan yang dihasilkan oleh sarang lebah,
4 ketika tiga bayangan memisahkan diri dari sekelompok orang 5 yang sedang berlari, melewati 6 di bawah hujan penderitaan yang pedih.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
7 Venian ver’ noi, e ciascuna gridava: 8 «Sòstati tu ch’a l’abito ne sembri 9 esser alcun di nostra terra prava».
query.result:
**English:**
7 They came towards us, and each one cried out: 8 "Stop, you who seem by your clothing 9 to be one of our evil land."
**Malay:**
7 Mereka datang ke arah kami, dan masing-masing berteriak: 8 "Berhentilah kamu yang dari pakaianmu kelihatan 9 sebagai salah seorang dari negeri jahat kami."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Ahimè, che piaghe vidi ne’ lor membri, 11 ricenti e vecchie, da le fiamme incese! 12 Ancor men duol pur ch’i’ me ne rimembri.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Alas, what wounds I saw upon their limbs, 11 recent and old, inflicted by the flames! 12 I still grieve, even though I recall them.
**Malay:**
10 Aduh, luka-luka apa yang kulihat pada anggota tubuh mereka, 11 baru dan lama, yang disebabkan oleh api! 12 Aku masih berduka meskipun aku mengingatnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 A le lor grida il mio dottor s’attese; 14 volse ’l viso ver’ me, e «Or aspetta», 15 disse, «a costor si vuole esser cortese.
query.result:
**English:**
13 At their loud cries my guide stopped; 14 he turned his face toward me and said, 15 “Now you must be courteous to these.”
**Malay:**
13 Mendengar teriakan mereka yang keras, pemanduku berhenti; 14 ia menoleh ke arahku dan berkata, 15 “Sekarang kamu harus bersikap sopan kepada mereka.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 E se non fosse il foco che saetta 17 la natura del loco, i’ dicerei 18 che meglio stesse a te che a lor la fretta».
query.result:
**English:**
16 And if it were not for the fire that flashes 17 from the nature of the place, I would say 18 that haste would suit you better than them».
**Malay:**
16 Dan jika bukan karena api yang menyambar 17 dari sifat tempat itu, aku akan berkata 18 bahwa tergesa-gesa lebih cocok untukmu daripada mereka».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Ricominciar, come noi restammo, ei 20 l’antico verso; e quando a noi fuor giunti, 21 fenno una rota di sé tutti e trei.
query.result:
**English:**
19 He began again, as we remained, 20 the ancient verse; and when he came to us, 21 all three of them made a circle of themselves.
**Malay:**
19 Ia mulai lagi, sebagaimana kami tetap, 20 syair kuno; dan ketika ia sampai pada kami, 21 mereka bertiga membuat lingkaran dari diri mereka sendiri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Qual sogliono i campion far nudi e unti, 23 avvisando lor presa e lor vantaggio, 24 prima che sien tra lor battuti e punti,
25 così rotando, ciascuno il visaggio 26 drizzava a me, sì che ’n contraro il collo 27 faceva ai piè continüo vïaggio.
query.result:
**English:**
22 As naked and oiled wrestlers are accustomed to do, 23 watching for their hold and advantage, 24 before they are locked together and grappling,
25 so they, wheeling around, each one turned his face 26 toward me, so that continually their necks 27 made a counter-journey to their feet.
**Malay:**
22 Seperti pegulat telanjang dan berminyak yang biasa melakukan, 23 mengawasi pegangan dan keuntungan mereka, 24 sebelum mereka terkunci bersama dan bergulat,
25 begitulah mereka, berputar-putar, masing-masing memalingkan wajahnya 26 ke arahku, sehingga terus-menerus leher mereka 27 melakukan perjalanan yang berlawanan dengan kaki mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 E «Se miseria d’esto loco sollo 29 rende in dispetto noi e nostri prieghi», 30 cominciò l’uno, «e ’l tinto aspetto e brollo,
31 la fama nostra il tuo animo pieghi 32 a dirne chi tu se’, che i vivi piedi 33 così sicuro per lo ’nferno freghi.
query.result:
**English:**
28 And "If the misery of this lonely place 29 makes us and our prayers contemptible," 30 one of them began, "and our discolored and naked appearance,
31 may our fame incline your mind 32 to tell us who you are, whose living feet 33 tread so confidently through hell.
**Malay:**
28 Dan "Jika kesengsaraan tempat yang sunyi ini 29 membuat kami dan doa-doa kami hina," 30 salah satu dari mereka memulai, "dan penampilan kami yang pucat dan telanjang,
31 semoga ketenaran kami mempengaruhi pikiran Anda 32 untuk memberi tahu kami siapa Anda, yang kakinya yang hidup 33 melangkah dengan begitu percaya diri melalui neraka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Questi, l’orme di cui pestar mi vedi, 35 tutto che nudo e dipelato vada, 36 fu di grado maggior che tu non credi:
37 nepote fu de la buona Gualdrada; 38 Guido Guerra ebbe nome, e in sua vita 39 fece col senno assai e con la spada.
query.result:
**English:**
34 This one, whose footprints you see me following, 35 who goes all naked and peeled, 36 was of a higher rank than you think:
37 he was the grandson of the good Gualdrada; 38 his name was Guido Guerra, and in his lifetime 39 he accomplished much with his wisdom and his sword.
**Malay:**
34 Orang ini, jejak kakinya yang kaulihat kuikuti, 35 yang berjalan telanjang dan terkelupas, 36 berpangkat lebih tinggi daripada yang kaupikirkan:
37 ia adalah cucu dari Gualdrada yang baik; 38 namanya Guido Guerra, dan semasa hidupnya 39 ia mencapai banyak hal dengan kebijaksanaan dan pedangnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 L’altro, ch’appresso me la rena trita, 41 è Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, la cui voce 42 nel mondo sù dovria esser gradita.
query.result:
**English:**
40 The other, who treads the sand behind me, 41 is Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, whose voice 42 should be welcomed in the world above.
**Malay:**
40 Yang lainnya, yang mengikutiku di atas pasir, 41 adalah Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, yang suaranya 42 seharusnya disambut di dunia atas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 E io, che posto son con loro in croce, 44 Iacopo Rusticucci fui, e certo 45 la fiera moglie più ch’altro mi nuoce».
query.result:
**English:**
43 And I, who am placed with them on the cross, 44 was Iacopo Rusticucci, and certainly 45 my fierce wife harms me more than anything else.
**Malay:**
43 Dan aku, yang ditempatkan bersama mereka di kayu salib, 44 adalah Iacopo Rusticucci, dan tentu saja 45 istriku yang galak lebih menyakitiku daripada apa pun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Poi cominciai: «Non dispetto, ma doglia 53 la vostra condizion dentro mi fisse, 54 tanta che tardi tutta si dispoglia,
55 tosto che questo mio segnor mi disse 56 parole per le quali i’ mi pensai 57 che qual voi siete, tal gente venisse.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Then I began: "Not scorn, but grief 53 made your condition seem so pitiful to me, 54 so much so that it will be slow to shed it all,
55 as soon as my lord said to me 56 words that made me think 57 that people like you were coming.
**Malay:**
52 Kemudian aku mulai: "Bukan penghinaan, tetapi kesedihan 53 membuat keadaan kalian tampak begitu menyedihkan bagiku, 54 sedemikian rupa sehingga akan lambat untuk melepaskan semuanya,
55 segera setelah tuanku berkata kepadaku 56 kata-kata yang membuatku berpikir 57 bahwa orang-orang seperti kalian akan datang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Di vostra terra sono, e sempre mai 59 l’ovra di voi e li onorati nomi 60 con affezion ritrassi e ascoltai.
query.result:
**English:**
58 I am from your land, and always 59 your work and your honored names 60 I have lovingly depicted and listened to.
**Malay:**
58 Aku dari tanahmu, dan selalu 59 karyamu dan nama-namamu yang terhormat 60 dengan kasih sayang kugambarkan dan kudengarkan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Lascio lo fele e vo per dolci pomi 62 promessi a me per lo verace duca; 63 ma ’nfino al centro pria convien ch’i’ tomi».
query.result:
**English:**
61 I leave the gall and go for the sweet apples 62 promised to me by the true guide; 63 but before that, it is necessary for me to reach the center.
**Malay:**
61 Aku meninggalkan empedu dan pergi untuk buah apel yang manis 62 yang dijanjikan kepadaku oleh pemandu yang sejati; 63 tetapi sebelum itu, perlu bagiku untuk mencapai pusatnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 «Se lungamente l’anima conduca 65 le membra tue», rispuose quelli ancora, 66 «e se la fama tua dopo te luca,
67 cortesia e valor dì se dimora 68 ne la nostra città sì come suole, 69 o se del tutto se n’è gita fora;
70 ché Guiglielmo Borsiere, il qual si duole 71 con noi per poco e va là coi compagni, 72 assai ne cruccia con le sue parole».
query.result:
**English:**
64 "If your soul leads your limbs for a long time," 65 he answered again, 66 "and if your fame shines after you,
67 tell me if courtesy and valor still dwell 68 in our city as they used to, 69 or if they have completely departed;
70 for Guiglielmo Borsiere, who grieves 71 with us for a short time and then goes with his companions, 72 greatly torments us with his words."
**Malay:**
64 "Jika jiwamu memimpin anggota tubuhmu untuk waktu yang lama," 65 jawabnya lagi, 66 "dan jika ketenaranmu bersinar setelah dirimu,
67 katakan padaku apakah kesopanan dan keberanian masih berdiam 68 di kota kita seperti dulu, 69 atau apakah mereka telah sepenuhnya pergi;
70 karena Guiglielmo Borsiere, yang berduka 71 bersama kami untuk waktu yang singkat dan kemudian pergi dengan teman-temannya, 72 sangat menyiksa kami dengan kata-katanya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 «La gente nuova e i sùbiti guadagni 74 orgoglio e dismisura han generata, 75 Fiorenza, in te, sì che tu già ten piagni».
query.result:
**English:**
73 "The new people and the sudden gains 74 have generated pride and excess, 75 Florence, in you, so that you already weep for it."
**Malay:**
73 "Orang-orang baru dan keuntungan yang tiba-tiba 74 telah menghasilkan kesombongan dan kemewahan, 75 Florence, di dalam dirimu, sehingga kamu sudah menangisi hal itu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Così gridai con la faccia levata; 77 e i tre, che ciò inteser per risposta, 78 guardar l’un l’altro com’ al ver si guata.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Thus I cried out with my face lifted up; 77 and the three, who understood this as an answer, 78 looked at each other as one looks at the truth.
**Malay:**
76 Demikianlah aku berteriak dengan wajah terangkat; 77 dan ketiganya, yang memahami ini sebagai jawaban, 78 saling memandang seperti seseorang memandang kebenaran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 «Se l’altre volte sì poco ti costa», 80 rispuoser tutti, «il satisfare altrui, 81 felice te se sì parli a tua posta!
82 Però, se campi d’esti luoghi bui 83 e torni a riveder le belle stelle, 84 quando ti gioverà dicere “I’ fui”,
85 fa che di noi a la gente favelle».
query.result:
**English:**
79 "If the other times it cost you so little," 80 they all replied, "to satisfy others, 81 happy are you if you speak so at your leisure!
82 Therefore, if you escape from these dark places 83 and return to see the beautiful stars again, 84 when it will please you to say "I was",
85 make sure to tell people about us."
**Malay:**
79 "Jika waktu-waktu yang lain itu sangat mudah bagimu," 80 mereka semua menjawab, "untuk memuaskan orang lain, 81 berbahagialah kamu jika kamu berbicara seperti itu semaumu!
82 Oleh karena itu, jika kamu melarikan diri dari tempat-tempat gelap ini 83 dan kembali untuk melihat bintang-bintang yang indah lagi, 84 ketika kamu senang untuk mengatakan "Aku dulu",
85 pastikan untuk memberi tahu orang-orang tentang kami."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
86 Indi rupper la rota, e a fuggirsi 87 ali sembiar le gambe loro isnelle.
88 Un amen non saria possuto dirsi 89 tosto così com’ e’ fuoro spariti; 90 per ch’al maestro parve di partirsi.
query.result:
**English:**
86 Then he turned the wheel, and to flee 87 their swift legs gave them wings.
88 One could not have said amen 89 as quickly as they disappeared; 90 so it seemed to the master that it was time to leave.
**Malay:**
86 Kemudian dia memutar roda, dan untuk melarikan diri 87 kaki mereka yang cepat memberi mereka sayap.
88 Seseorang tidak dapat mengucapkan amin 89 secepat mereka menghilang; 90 jadi bagi sang guru tampaknya sudah waktunya untuk pergi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Io lo seguiva, e poco eravam iti, 92 che ’l suon de l’acqua n’era sì vicino, 93 che per parlar saremmo a pena uditi.
query.result:
**English:**
91 I followed him, and we were a short distance away, 92 that the sound of the water was so near, 93 that to speak we would have been scarcely heard.
**Malay:**
91 Aku mengikutinya, dan kami berada tidak jauh, 92 sehingga bunyi air itu begitu dekat, 93 sehingga untuk berbicara kami hampir tidak terdengar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Come quel fiume c’ha proprio cammino 95 prima dal Monte Viso ’nver’ levante, 96 da la sinistra costa d’Apennino,
97 che si chiama Acquacheta suso, avante 98 che si divalli giù nel basso letto, 99 e a Forlì di quel nome è vacante,
100 rimbomba là sovra San Benedetto 101 de l’Alpe per cadere ad una scesa 102 ove dovea per mille esser recetto;
103 così, giù d’una ripa discoscesa, 104 trovammo risonar quell’ acqua tinta, 105 sì che ’n poc’ ora avria l’orecchia offesa.
query.result:
**English:**
94 Like that river which has its own course 95 first from Monte Viso towards the east, 96 from the left side of the Apennines,
97 which is called Acquacheta above, before 98 it flows down into the low riverbed, 99 and at Forlì that name is vacant,
100 it roars there above San Benedetto 101 of the Alps to fall down a slope 102 where it was supposed to be received by a thousand;
103 thus, down a steep bank, 104 we found that dark water resounding, 105 so that in a short time it would have offended the ear.
**Malay:**
94 Seperti sungai yang mempunyai alirannya sendiri 95 pertama dari Monte Viso ke arah timur, 96 dari sisi kiri Pegunungan Apennini,
97 yang disebut Acquacheta di atas, sebelum 98 mengalir turun ke dasar sungai yang rendah, 99 dan di Forlì nama itu kosong,
100 bergemuruh di sana di atas San Benedetto 101 dari Pegunungan Alpen untuk jatuh ke sebuah lereng 102 di mana seharusnya diterima oleh seribu;
103 demikian, menuruni tebing yang curam, 104 kami menemukan air gelap itu bergema, 105 sehingga dalam waktu singkat akan menyinggung telinga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Io avea una corda intorno cinta, 107 e con essa pensai alcuna volta 108 prender la lonza a la pelle dipinta.
query.result:
**English:**
106 I had a cord around my waist, 107 and with it I thought to catch 108 the leopard with the painted skin.
**Malay:**
106 Aku mempunyai seutas tali di pinggangku, 107 dan dengannya kupikirkan untuk menangkap 108 macan tutul dengan kulit yang berbintik-bintik.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Poscia ch’io l’ebbi tutta da me sciolta, 110 sì come ’l duca m’avea comandato, 111 porsila a lui aggroppata e ravvolta.
query.result:
**English:**
109 After I had completely untied it from myself, 110 just as my guide had commanded me, 111 I offered it to him, tied and bundled up.
**Malay:**
109 Setelah aku melepaskannya sepenuhnya dariku, 110 sebagaimana pemandu telah memerintahkanku, 111 kuserahkan kepadanya dalam keadaan terikat dan terbungkus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Ond’ ei si volse inver’ lo destro lato, 113 e alquanto di lunge da la sponda 114 la gittò giuso in quell’ alto burrato.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Then he turned to his right side, 113 and from a little distance from the bank 114 he threw it down into that deep ravine.
**Malay:**
112 Kemudian dia berpaling ke sisi kanannya, 113 dan dari jarak yang agak jauh dari tepi 114 dia melemparkannya ke bawah ke dalam jurang yang dalam itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 ‘E’ pur convien che novità risponda’, 116 dicea fra me medesmo, ‘al novo cenno 117 che ’l maestro con l’occhio sì seconda’.
query.result:
**English:**
115 ‘And yet it is fitting that novelty should respond’, 116 I said to myself, ‘to the new sign 117 that the master follows with his eye’.
**Malay:**
115 ‘Dan meskipun begitu, adalah pantas jika hal yang baru menanggapi’, 116 kataku dalam hati, ‘tanda yang baru 117 yang diikuti oleh sang guru dengan matanya’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Ahi quanto cauti li uomini esser dienno 119 presso a color che non veggion pur l’ovra, 120 ma per entro i pensier miran col senno!
121 El disse a me: «Tosto verrà di sovra 122 ciò ch’io attendo e che il tuo pensier sogna; 123 tosto convien ch’al tuo viso si scovra».
query.result:
**English:**
118 Ah, how cautious men should be 119 with those who do not see only the deed, 120 but look with their minds into the thoughts!
121 He said to me: "Soon will come from above 122 that which I await and which your thought dreams of; 123 soon it is fitting that it be revealed to your sight."
**Malay:**
118 Ah, betapa berhati-hatinya manusia seharusnya 119 dengan mereka yang tidak hanya melihat perbuatan, 120 tetapi melihat ke dalam pikiran dengan akal budi!
121 Dia berkata kepadaku: "Segera akan datang dari atas 122 apa yang kutunggu dan yang diimpikan oleh pikiranmu; 123 segera sudah sepantasnya agar hal itu disingkapkan kepada pandanganmu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Sempre a quel ver c’ha faccia di menzogna 125 de’ l’uom chiuder le labbra fin ch’el puote, 126 però che sanza colpa fa vergogna;
127 ma qui tacer nol posso; e per le note 128 di questa comedìa, lettor, ti giuro, 129 s’elle non sien di lunga grazia vòte,
130 ch’i’ vidi per quell’ aere grosso e scuro 131 venir notando una figura in suso, 132 maravigliosa ad ogne cor sicuro,
133 sì come torna colui che va giuso 134 talora a solver l’àncora ch’aggrappa 135 o scoglio o altro che nel mare è chiuso,
136 che ’n sù si stende e da piè si rattrappa.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Always to that truth which has the face of a lie 125 should a man close his lips as long as he can, 126 because without fault it brings shame;
127 but here I cannot be silent; and by the notes 128 of this comedy, reader, I swear to you, 129 if they are not devoid of long grace,
130 that I saw through that thick and dark air 131 a figure swimming upward, 132 marvelous to every steadfast heart,
133 just as he who goes down sometimes returns 134 to loosen the anchor that grapples 135 a rock or something else that is hidden in the sea,
136 which stretches out above and gathers itself in at the foot.
**Malay:**
124 Selalu pada kebenaran itu yang berwajah dusta 125 haruslah manusia menutup bibirnya selama ia mampu, 126 karena tanpa salah itu mendatangkan malu;
127 tetapi di sini aku tidak dapat berdiam diri; dan demi catatan-catatan 128 dari komedi ini, pembaca, aku bersumpah kepadamu, 129 jika catatan-catatan itu tidak kosong dari kasih karunia yang panjang,
130 bahwa aku melihat melalui udara yang tebal dan gelap itu 131 datang berenang ke atas sebuah sosok, 132 menakjubkan bagi setiap hati yang teguh,
133 seperti halnya orang yang turun terkadang kembali 134 untuk melepaskan jangkar yang mencengkeram 135 batu karang atau benda lain yang tersembunyi di laut,
136 yang membentang di atas dan berkumpul di kaki.
